title: Run Benchmark Comparison with Ollama Models
description:
## Problem Statement
After optimizations to the extraction pipeline, we need to verify that quality has not degraded by comparing against the original implementation at /Users/marchansen/GitHub/HKUDS/LightRAG.

## Current Status
✅ Infrastructure complete:
- compare_benchmarks.py created
- Ollama models pulled (qwen2.5-coder:1.5b, nomic-embed-text:v1.5)

⏳ Remaining work:
- Run Few-NERD benchmarks on both repos
- Run Text2KGBench benchmarks on both repos
- Generate comparison report
- Analyze results for regressions

## Requirements
1. Run identical benchmark tests on both repositories
2. Compare entity extraction quality metrics
3. Compare token usage and performance
4. Identify any regressions or improvements
5. Generate comparison report

## Commands
```bash
# Run comparison with 10 cases
python compare_benchmarks.py --cases 10 --output benchmark_comparison_report.md

# For faster results, use larger model
# Edit compare_benchmarks.py: llm_model_name="qwen2.5-coder:7b"
```

title: P0: Review Tests & Integrate Academic Benchmarks
description:
Review existing extraction tests, identify coverage gaps, and integrate academic benchmarks (Few-NERD, Text2KGBench) for rigorous quality validation. This is a prerequisite for the token optimization work (lightrag-9wg) to ensure we can measure quality improvements.

## Phase 1: Current Test Review (3 days)
- [ ] Document all 54 test files (TEST_INVENTORY.md)
- [ ] Analyze extraction coverage gaps (COVERAGE_ANALYSIS.md)
- [ ] Benchmark current performance (BASELINE_PERFORMANCE.md)

## Phase 2: Academic Benchmark Research (4 days)
- [ ] Download & prepare Few-NERD (200 sentences subset)
- [ ] Download & prepare Text2KGBench (150 sentences subset)
- [ ] Map entity types to LightRAG 11 types (ENTITY_TYPE_MAPPING.md)
- [ ] Create benchmark test suite (tests/test_academic_benchmarks.py)

## Phase 3: Integration & Validation (7 days)
- [ ] Create evaluation metrics (tests/benchmarks/eval_metrics.py)
- [ ] Implement light benchmark tests (@pytest.mark.light)
- [ ] Implement heavy benchmark tests (@pytest.mark.heavy)
- [ ] Complete documentation

## Deliverables
- TEST_INVENTORY.md
- COVERAGE_ANALYSIS.md
- BASELINE_PERFORMANCE.md
- ENTITY_TYPE_MAPPING.md
- BENCHMARK_INTEGRATION.md
- tests/benchmarks/ directory
- tests/test_academic_benchmarks.py
- tests/benchmarks/eval_metrics.py
- Baseline metrics for entity recall, precision, F1

## Related Issues (Future)
- Fine-grained entity type mapping (P2)
- Original repo benchmark comparison (P2)
close_reason: Completed Phase 1-3: Test review, benchmark research, and integration. Created 5 documentation files, evaluation metrics module, 50-case Few-NERD dataset, 25-case Text2KGBench dataset, and 21 light tests + 6 heavy tests. All light tests passing.

title: Experiment with automem for agent long-term memory
description: Integrate automem (~/GitHub/verygoodplugins/automem) to improve AI agent long-term memory across sessions. Automem is a graph+vector memory system with 90.53% LoCoMo benchmark score. Goals: (1) Deploy automem locally via 'make dev', (2) Store session learnings, patterns, and preferences, (3) Recall relevant memories at session start, (4) Evaluate if it improves agent continuity vs current memory.md approach. See automem docs: README.md, agents.md, docs/AGENT_FIELD_GUIDE.md.
close_reason: Superseded by effective memory.md approach - memory.md is actively maintained and working well for agent long-term memory. Automem infrastructure remains available for other uses like conversation persistence evaluation (lightrag-990).

title: Extend query responses to include citation links to original source
close_reason: Implemented automatic citation generation using Zilliz semantic highlighting. Key changes: 1) Enhanced lightrag/highlight.py with get_highlights_with_positions() and generate_citations_from_highlights() functions for citation-ready format with confidence scoring, 2) Added auto_citations and citation_threshold parameters to QueryParam in lightrag/base.py, 3) Integrated automatic citation generation into query pipeline (lightrag/operate.py) with _generate_citations_with_auto_highlight() helper function that conditionally uses Zilliz-based or frequency-based citation generation, 4) Added API endpoint support in lightrag/api/routers/query_routes.py, 5) Created comprehensive test suite in tests/test_auto_citations.py. When auto_citations=True, the system automatically generates citations based on semantic relevance using the Zilliz highlighting model, providing more accurate source attribution with confidence scores.

title: Test conversation persistence systems: Automem vs file-based vs competitors

title:
Implement RRF fusion for context precision improvement

**Problem**: Current mix mode produces 0% context precision on small documents.

**Solution**: Implement Reciprocal Rank Fusion to score documents by consensus ranking across retrieval methods.

**Implementation**: RRF algorithm in operate.py + API integration + unit tests.

**Expected Impact**: Context precision: 0% → 75%+, RAGAS score: 0.69 → 0.80+

**Priority**: High - addresses critical precision issue from baseline evaluation.
Audit and optimize extraction/reflection prompts for 1.5B/7B models
notes: Created comprehensive baseline audit script (run_prompt_baseline_audit.py). Script measures entity recall, relationship accuracy, YAML compliance, hallucination rate, and execution time across multiple model sizes. Ready to execute benchmarks.

title: Implement Agent Coordination System
description: Implement multi-agent coordination to prevent conflicts and enable real-time awareness. Include: 1) Session lock files with heartbeat, 2) Beads integration for task claiming, 3) Agent status visibility. See AGENTS.md for details after implementation.
close_reason: Phase 1 complete: Implemented session lock system with heartbeat mechanism. Created agent-start.sh, agent-end.sh, agent-heartbeat.sh, and agent-status.sh scripts. Updated AGENTS.md with comprehensive documentation. All scripts tested and working. Agents can now: 1) Create session locks on start, 2) Check for other active agents, 3) Update heartbeats automatically, 4) Clean up locks on exit. System prevents conflicts and enables real-time visibility into agent activity.

Created proactive_improvements.py with comprehensive pattern analysis across FlightDirector diagnostics, learnings, and code patterns. title: Add support for keyword search.
Fine-grained Entity Type Mapping
description:
Fine-grained Entity Type Mapping

Enhance entity type mapping to support 66 Few-NERD types with hierarchical structure, preserving fine-grained information while maintaining compatibility with LightRAG's 11 entity types.

## Problem Statement
Currently, entity types are mapped from 66 Few-NERD types to 11 LightRAG types using a simple 1-to-1 mapping. This loses fine-grained type information important for research-grade evaluation.

## Requirements
1. Support hierarchical type mapping (66 -> 11 -> fine-grained)
2. Preserve original benchmark types in entity metadata
3. Allow flexible remapping between benchmarks
4. Support custom type hierarchies via configuration
5. Maintain backward compatibility with existing code

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Hierarchical Type System (3 days)
- Define type hierarchy for all 66 Few-NERD types
- Create type registry with metadata
- Implement hierarchical mapping functions

### Phase 2: Flexible Mapper Class (2 days)
- Create EntityTypeMapper class
- Add preserve_fine_grained option
- Support custom hierarchies via config

### Phase 3: Integration (2 days)
- Update eval_metrics.py to use new mapper
- Update test_academic_benchmarks.py
- Add validation tests

### Phase 4: Documentation (1 day)
- Document type hierarchy
- Add usage examples
- Update ENTITY_TYPE_MAPPING.md

## Deliverables
- tests/benchmarks/type_hierarchy.py - Type hierarchy definitions
- tests/benchmarks/entity_type_mapper.py - Flexible mapper class
- Updated evaluation metrics with hierarchy support
- Documentation of type hierarchy
- Migration guide for existing code

## Success Criteria
- All 66 Few-NERD types mapped hierarchically
- Original types preserved in metadata
- Backward compatibility maintained
- Type hierarchy documented
close_reason: Completed fine-grained entity type mapping: - Created type_hierarchy.py with 66 Few-NERD types in 8 categories - Created EntityTypeMapper class with metadata preservation - Added custom hierarchy and mapping support - Created 19 tests (all passing) - Documented in FINE_GRAINED_MAPPING.md
